text:

Screenshot of statistics

There is a wrong total line in generated report dashboard - statistics.

The total line is populated with the values from the last sampler.

Should be related to bug #60107

spamy@symtoo.com
text:
Created attachment 34582
Test case to reproduce a bug

Hello.

I am attaching a test case with results dir (containing logs and jmx). I installed jmeter 3.1 without any modifications.

This is the command I used to invoke a test case:

jmeter -n -t sme.jmx -l results/samples.jtl \
  -e -o report -Jjmeter.reportgenerator.overall_granularity=5000 \
  -Jsummariser.ignore_transaction_controller_sample_result=false \
  -j results/jmeter.log

Now the generated result is different. Total samples is 0.

My full test case is in the attached tar, but briefly it looks like

Thread Group
  - Transaction controller (generate parent sample)
     - HTTP Sampler
  - Transaction controller (generate parent sample)
     - HTTP Sampler

Created attachment 34583
The Total is now 0
creator: spamy@symtoo.com

text:
Your issue is due to checking generate parent sample.
In such case we don't compute TOTAL because we ignore controllers.

Correct configuration for generating report is described in docs:
- http://jmeter.apache.org/usermanual/generating-dashboard.html

Pay attention to:
- http://jmeter.apache.org/usermanual/generating-dashboard.html#configuration_requirements


JMeter is very flexible and has a long past, but sometimes we have to make choices to progress and provide new features.
We decided in the case of Report/Dashboard that we would only support correct generation if requirements are met.

Closing as WONTFIX.
Unless there is a particular case blocking you from following requirements, in this latter case , feel free to reopen with more details on your issues.


Thanks for report.
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com

text: *** Bug 60609 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com

text:
Philippe: I can't get what's wrong with transaction controllers.

But from my point of this issue is - if TC were working as expected (from my point of view as I was using TC) in 3.0 and now the total lines are just copying the values from last TC, what's wrong to count that report table to the totals?

As there are a duplicates, it looks like I am not the only one, who can't understood what's wrong in summarising TC.

I just want in my reports to have only groupped transactions

Login
Show item
Add idtem to basket
Checkout
Payment
Summary order

Not large amounts of http requests that comes with my page (images, css, js). The loading of assets is important and I am interested of how long does take single step - Show item (with all images and js), therefor I am groupping that stuff in TC and turning on the Generate parent samples.
creator: spamy@symtoo.com

text:
Hello,
You can get what you want by using:
jmeter.reportgenerator.exporter.html.series_filter 
property where you'll put the TCs you want.

That's how the report were built.
There are other reasons for this choice, see:

- Bug 60107
- Bug 60105


Regards
Philippe
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
